messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On May 10, DET. L. D. Walker was alerted about a multi-store break-in at Oakridge Plaza. Key witnesses were Mrs. Robinson, a store owner, and Mr. Kelley, the plaza's security guard. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. T. A. Stevens - OPERATIONS Det. Walker, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. In collaboration, Detective R. P. Nolan and Detective J. L. Fisher assisted in evidence collection. SHERIDAN 22:40 Break-In Mrs. Robinson found her store's cash register emptied, and Mr. Kelley's security footage showed a group of masked individuals. Glass. Technician Lucas procured samples from broken windows. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Walker Jr, Det. Nolan, Det. Fisher OPERATIONS Lt. Stevens INFORMANT Kelley, Mark 55 Maple Drive, Oakridge, Florida 138-480. 91895. SHERIDAN 22:40 Break-In By 1:15 AM, Detectives Walker, Nolan, and Fisher, together with Lieutenant Stevens, reviewed all security tapes, identifying a potential getaway vehicle. Captain H. V. Brooks organized a search team. Sergeant A. M. Pierce and Sergeant D. K. Hayes coordinated the interviews of nearby residents. By 2:30 AM, a list of stolen items from various stores was compiled by Detective J. L. Fisher. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Walker Jr, Det. Nolan, Det. Fisher OPERATIONS Lt. Stevens AFFIDAVIT - Break-In Report 1) Security Tapes 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Stolen Items List 5) Plaza Entry Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE P. Mitchell O.P.D. 10.80 P30 1287 Robinson, AMY NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 80-1569 DETECTIVE: L. WALKER ITEM: 30-4450- 87 CRIME: 22:40 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 81400 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 11/25/22 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. L. D. Walker  Officer Context: On May 10, DET. L. D. Walker was alerted about a multi-store break-in at Oakridge Plaza. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. T. A. Stevens  Officer Context: Lt. T. A. Stevens - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective R. P. Nolan  Officer Context: In collaboration, Detective R. P. Nolan and Detective J. L. Fisher assisted in evidence collection. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective J. L. Fisher  Officer Context: In collaboration, Detective R. P. Nolan and Detective J. L. Fisher assisted in evidence collection. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Lucas  Officer Context: Glass. Technician Lucas procured samples from broken windows. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Walker  Officer Context: By 1:15 AM, Detectives Walker, Nolan, and Fisher, together with Lieutenant Stevens, reviewed all security tapes. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Nolan  Officer Context: By 1:15 AM, Detectives Walker, Nolan, and Fisher, together with Lieutenant Stevens, reviewed all security tapes. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Fisher  Officer Context: By 1:15 AM, Detectives Walker, Nolan, and Fisher, together with Lieutenant Stevens, reviewed all security tapes. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain H. V. Brooks  Officer Context: Captain H. V. Brooks organized a search team. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant A. M. Pierce  Officer Context: Sergeant A. M. Pierce and Sergeant D. K. Hayes coordinated the interviews of nearby residents. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant D. K. Hayes Officer Context: Sergeant A. M. Pierce and Sergeant D. K. Hayes coordinated the interviews of nearby residents. Officer Role: Sergeant
